description:
"Justice" opens up a new world. In the near future, the Sybil System, a surveillance network that quantifies human souls, maintains public order. In a changing world, detectives with Dominators, guns that measure "Crime Coefficients," pursue "latent criminals" before they commit crimes. The third series of PSYCHO-PASS follows two inspectors seeking the truth: Arata Shindou and Kei Mikhail Ignatov.

(Source: Amazon)

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/170696565)

Shiotani grew up admiring Ghibli films and Ghost in the Shell, so he decided to enroll in an animation school in order to be able to participate in the creating process of anime. After graduating he joined [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) becoming one of their most promising young animators. 

After some years spent climbing to the position of animation director on series such as [Windy Tales](https://anilist.co/anime/1524/Windy-Tales/), he left his first creative mark on the industry by directing, storyboarding and supervising [Blood+](https://anilist.co/anime/150/)'s kaleidoscopic 3rd Opening. 

He had his directorial debut with [Tokyo Marble Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/3088/), OVA produced as a collaboration between Production I.G. and BMG Japan in commemoration of both companies' 20th anniversaries. The OVA was awarded the Grand Prize in the Feature Film Category of the 12th Seoul International Cartoon & Animation Festival in 2008.

Shiotani is most famous for being the director of the [Psycho-Pass](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/) series. Initially planned with a post-apocalyptic setting, the concept changed after the Great East Japan Earthquake and evolved into its final form. The series is inspired by detective crime stories and sci-fi (Minority Report, Blade Runner, Ghost in the Shell, Patlabor) with the precise intent of exploring societal problems.

__Debut__: 1998

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/amano_akira_)

Akira Amano is the author and mangaka of the shonen manga Katekyo Hitman Reborn! They were born in 1973, but the month and day are unknown.  Amano began in 1998 with a job at Weekly Young Magazine. They also held a job at Shueisha Publishing Co, Ltd.  In 2002, Amano participated in a contest for aspiring mangaka and was one of the lucky winners, with their comic Monkey Business published in Young Magazine.  In 2004, they finally found success with the humorous and classy manga Katekyo Hitman Reborn! (or, for short, just Reborn!), and that thanks to their readers' support. This new manga was advertised more and more in Shonen Jump and became a hit. Two years later, their manga was made into an anime series by Artland studios. 

Their ideas for Reborn!: Amano had some crazy ideas to entertain readers with. They came up with weird characters to add spice to the humor, a story written especially to be unique, and fast-paced action.    

Other works:  Boy Spin (1998)  Hot Blast Baseball Legendary (1999)  Pu Chipu Chirabii (2000)  Monkey Business (2002)  Tapir Hearts HAWK! (2003)  Katekyo Hitman Reborn! (2004)    Colleagues:  Ken Osamu Sakaki  KAITO  Main pine of indigo  Kobayashi  Kasuga truth

Ubukata was exposed to a blending of cultures from early childhood until the age of fourteen, having lived in Singapore and Nepal because of his father's work. In 1996, while in college, Ubukata won the first Sneaker Taisho Gold Prize for his light novel Kuroi Kisetsu, and thus debuted as a writer. In 2003, he won the Nihon SF Taisho Award for Mardock Scramble, originally published as a three-volume series. He is involved in a wide range of projects including anime production for Fafner, video game production, and original content writing for comics such as Le Chevalier D'Eon. His other works include the Bye-Bye Earth and Spiegel novel series. In 2009, he published his first historical novel, Tenchi Meisatsu, focusing on a mathematician of the Edo period.

In 1996, while in college, Ubukata won the first Sneaker Taisho Gold Prize for his light novel Kuroi Kisetsu, and thus debuted as a writer. In 2003, he won the Nihon SF Taisho Award for Mardock Scramble, originally published as a three-volume series. He is involved in a wide range of projects including anime production for Fafner, video game production, and original content writing for comics such as Le Chevalier D'Eon. His other works include the Bye-Bye Earth and Spiegel novel series. In 2009, he published his first historical novel, Tenchi Meisatsu, focusing on a mathematician of the Edo period.

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/i/user/110221339) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/815589398720847872)

He joined studio Bebow in 1982, where he was referred to by [Masayuki Yagi](https://anilist.co/staff/143406/), a senior of his at Engaru High School. [Yoshikazu Yasuhiko](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/) and Bebow’s founder [Tomonori Kogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/105957/) were also graduates of the same school - the latter whom he would study under after joining the studio. There he made his debut as a key animator on [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/) in the following year.

He left Bebow in the mid ‘80s and joined Pack, a small studio established by [Hiroyuki Kitazume](https://anilist.co/staff/106775/). During this time he was a follower of Kitazume’s, who has said that Onda was the one capable of replicating his drawing’s the best out of the people who worked at studio Pack. After that he joined [Atelier Giga](https://anilist.co/staff/106775/) and worked there until becoming a freelancer.

His drawings feature western-influenced delicate and sharp linework with an excellent grasp on three-dimensionality. His character art in particular is highly praised both inside and outside of the industry, which he gets to brandish whenever he works as an animation supervisor. He has stated that he prefers character design and supervision work over working as an animator himself.

In 2003, he took part as a key animator on [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/)'s animated segment in Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" directed by [Kazuto Nakazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101474/). He is also a huge fan of shoujo manga since a young age due to his older sister.

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/i/user/110221339) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/815589398720847872)

__[Website](http://coshunie.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/co_shu_nie)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/C%C3%B6-shu-Nie-%E3%82%B3%E3%82%B7%E3%83%A5%E3%83%8B%E3%82%A8-151218092226983/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/coshunie_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWIfHAlwe1kELZDqUmD8oRg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0LlH6J1tj2TPq7AlwXAkY5)__ | __[Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/jp/artist/c%C3%B6-shu-nie/573663755)__

__Formed:__ 2011, Osaka Prefecture
__Genres:__ Rock (Indie Rock, Pop Rock)

__Biography:__
Co shu Nie (stylized as Cö shu Nie) is a Japanese two-member rock band under record label Sony Music Associated Records that debuted on June 6, 2018 with the single titled "[asphyxia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZB9UvUJL_lE)". Their single was used as the opening theme in the third season of [Tokyo Ghoul:re](https://anilist.co/anime/100240/Tokyo-Ghoulre). 

Prior to their debut, however, the band initially independently released their first mini album titled _Hydra_ all the way back in 2013, and according to their vocalist Miku Nakamura, the band name "Cö shu Nie" has no literal meaning, but they instead "became the meaning of the word".

__Members:__
- [Miku Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/162259) (中村未来) - vocalist, guitarist, keyboardist, manipulator (2011–)
- Shunsuke Matsumoto (松本駿介) - bass guitarist (2011–)


__Former Members:__
- Kojiro Yamazakoo (ヤマザキコウジロウ) - drummer (2011–2017)
- Ryosuke Fujita (藤田亮介) - drummer (2018–2021)

(Source: [Wikipedia (Cö shu Nie)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%B6_shu_Nie), edited)

name.native: フーヤエクステンデッド

node.description:
[Website](https://www.wyxt.info/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/wyxt_official) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3sE3971KYAw7t9ENx8Eqwk)

__Introduction:__
Who-ya Extended is a Japanese creative unit centered around the vocalist フーヤ (Who-ya).

__Biography:__
The unit first debuted in anime by performing the opening theme song titled "[Qvism](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zo5Q5ea1WDw)" in the TV anime [Psycho-Pass 3](https://anilist.co/anime/108307/PSYCHOPASS-3/), which started broadcasting on Fuji TV's "noitaminA" television block on October 24, 2019. A month later the unit made their major debut by releasing a full version of the single.

The unit would soon reappear in the sequel movie [Psycho-Pass 3: First Inspector](https://anilist.co/anime/113917/PSYCHOPASS-3-First-Inspector-/), with a brand new single titled "[Synthetic Sympathy](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y9PRpTiZvco)". The full version of the song was released and available for digital purchase on March 9, 2020.

(Source; [Who-ya Extended's Official Website](https://www.wyxt.info/profile/), edited)

Nishio graduated from Nagoya Designer Academy and started his career at Anime Spot, a subcontracting studio, after being refused in interviews with several animation studios. He debuted as an in-betweener on [Osomatsu-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/9883/) and as a key animator on [Laughing Salesman](https://anilist.co/anime/3077/).

It's on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392//) that Nishio came into his own as an animator, developing weighty and realistic movements influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/). Thanks to the ability demonstrated there, he was chosen to design the characters for [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

After working as character designer and chief animation director on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) he permanently joined Production I.G. where he became known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Kazuchika Kise](https://anilist.co/staff/115781/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

[Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/) requested for Nishio to be the character designer of the Naruto anime.

In August 2020, he was promoted to company director of Production I.G alongside [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/Takayuki-Gotou/), a co-founder of the studio.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/170696565)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/god_valley_to2)

Tomomi Kamiya is an animator and director.
